meanings.definition: To sell goods by calling out in the street
meanings.sent1: The vendor was hawking fresh fruits and vegetables in the market.
meanings.sent2: He hawks newspapers every morning to earn money.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be hawking toys to their imaginary customers.
meanings.sent4: The salesman was hawking his products with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The street performer was hawking his CDs to passersby.

meanings.definition: The act of hunting with trained hawks
meanings.sent1: Hawking requires patience and skill in training the birds.
meanings.sent2: The ancient art of hawking has been passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The nobleman enjoyed the sport of hawking in the countryside.
meanings.sent4: The falconer demonstrated the art of hawking to the curious crowd.
meanings.sent5: Watching hawking in action is a breathtaking experience.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a person coughing or clearing their throat
meanings.sent1: His loud hawking interrupted the silence in the library.
meanings.sent2: The hawking from the back of the room indicated someone was unwell.
meanings.sent3: The comedian used exaggerated hawking noises for comic effect.
meanings.sent4: The hawking echoed through the auditorium, causing heads to turn.
meanings.sent5: The sudden hawking startled everyone in the quiet room.
